intro: Conoclinium betonicum, commonly known as the Mexican trumpet vine, is a member of the茄科 (Solanaceae) family. It is a vigorous, herbaceous perennial that produces striking, tubular, orange-red flowers. The plant is native to Mexico and has been naturalized in parts of the United States. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including hummingbirds and bees, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
